executive_summary: The Monaco Grand Prix 2023 was decided by strategic pit stop timing and effective tire management. Max Verstappen demonstrated superior pace, particularly in the high-speed sectors, while maintaining consistency throughout the race. The race featured two distinct phases: an aggressive opening stint with soft tires, followed by a strategic hard compound stint that proved advantageous. Weather remained stable throughout, allowing teams to execute planned strategies without major disruptions.
key_points: Verstappen dominated in Sectors 2 and 3 throughout the race
Early pit stop window (laps 20-25) created strategic advantage for Red Bull
Hard tire compound showed superior degradation profile in final stint
Mercedes' hard compound choice in second stint struggled with grip management
Safety car windows did not significantly impact race outcome

timeline.event: Race start - Verstappen takes early advantage in turn 1
Minor incident at Turn 6 (Portier), no safety car required
Red Bull pit stop for Verstappen - soft to hard tires
Mercedes pit stop for Hamilton - soft to hard tires
Brief spin incident, driver recovered without damage
